helpOverlay.helpTitle: CO<sub>2</sub> emissions for 3 latitudinal bands (left) and the 5 continents (right) partitioned into 3 sources (rivers, lakes, estuaries) as estimated using a bottom-up (BU) approach relying on high spatial-resolution (0.5°) products. These estimates are mean climatologies for the last 3–4 decades. Hover over a region, source or flow path to see its contribution to the global CO<sub>2</sub> budget of inland waters.
helpOverlay.helpBU: Bottom-up estimates: based on diverse data inventories and observation-driven upscaling approaches.
helpOverlay.helpInlandwater: Global lake, estuary and river surface areas are 3.106, 1.106, and 0.65.106 km2, respectively.

pageText.title: Carbon fluxes across countries and regions from inland water sources
pageText.infotext: Present-day inland water carbon flux estimates in Tg C yr-1 from 3 inland sources (Rivers, Lakes, and Estuaries) for 3 latitude bands and 6 regions. Stacked bars show breakdown by country for each region. Data sources: Hastie et al. (2018), Lauerwald et al. (2015), Laruelle et al. (2013), Raymond et al. (2013), and Regnier et al. (2013).
pageText.subtitle: Total inland water carbon fluxes: 1292.0 Tg C yr<sup>-1</sup>
